DND5E.title: DnD5e Game System
DND5E.AbilityUseHint: Configure how you would like to use the {name} {type}.
DND5E.AbilityUseUnavailableHint: There are no uses of this item remaining!
DND5E.AbilityUseChargedHint: This {type} is charged and ready to use!
DND5E.AbilityUseRechargeHint: This {type} is depleted and must be recharged!
DND5E.AbilityUseNormalHint: This {type} has {value} of {max} uses per {per} remaining.
DND5E.AbilityUseConsumableChargeHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 charge of {value} remaining.
DND5E.AbilityUseConsumableQuantityHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 quantity of {quantity} remaining
DND5E.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyHint: Using this {type} will consume its final charge and it will be destroyed.
DND5E.AbilityConfigure: Configure Ability Checks and Saving Throws
DND5E.AbilityConfigurationHint: Configure ability saving throw proficiency, saving throw bonuses, and check bonuses.
DND5E.AbilityCheckGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all ability checks made by this actor.
DND5E.ActionWarningNoItem: The requested item {item} no longer exists on Actor {name}
DND5E.ActionWarningNoToken: You must have one or more controlled Tokens in order to use this option.
DND5E.ActorWarningInvalidItem: {itemType} items cannot be added to a {actorType}.
DND5E.ActiveEffectOverrideWarning: This value is being modified by an Active Effect and cannot be edited. Disable the effect to edit it.
DND5E.AddEmbeddedItemPromptHint: Do you want to add these items to your character sheet?
DND5E.AdvancementDeleteConfirmationMessa: Deleting this item will also delete all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
DND5E.AdvancementHitPointsHint: Track the player's hit points for each level in the class.
DND5E.AdvancementHitPointsEmptyError: Hit points must be rolled or the average value must be taken.
DND5E.AdvancementHitPointsInvalidError: Hit points must be a valid whole number.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantHint: Grant the character items (such as equipment, features, or spells) when they reach a certain level.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantDropHint: Drop Items here to add them to the list granted by this advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantDuplicateWarni: That item already exists on this advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantRecursiveWarni: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantOptionalHint: If optional, players will be given the option to opt out of any of the following items, otherwise all of them are granted.
DND5E.AdvancementItemTypeInvalidWarning: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
DND5E.AdvancementLevelDownConfirmationMe: Leveling this class down will also undo all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
DND5E.AdvancementManagerCloseMessage: If the advancement process is cancelled, choices made so far will be discarded and no changes will be made to the actor.
DND5E.AdvancementManagerRestartConfirm: Are you sure you wish to undo all choices so far?
DND5E.AdvancementMigrationHint: Select which of the following advancements will be added to {name}.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueHint: A single value that changes as a class increases in level that is made available in roll formulas (such as a Monk's martial arts die).
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueIdentifierHin: This scale value for the current level will be available using @scale.{class}.{identifier} in a formula.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintCR: Use this for representing creature challenge ratings for features like Wild Shape.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDice: Use this for dice values like bardic inspiration, sneak attack, or superiority dice.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDista: Use this for numerical values that represent a distance, such as unarmored movement speed, or aura of protection radius.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintNumbe: Use this for purely numerical values like rage damage bonus or number of uses per day.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintStrin: Use this if you are unsure of the type of the scale values, or if the type does not matter.
DND5E.ArmorConfigHint: Fill in the above box to override automatically calculated armor class.
DND5E.BonusesHint: Define global bonuses as formulas which are added to certain rolls. For example: 1d4 + 2
DND5E.BonusesInstructions: Configure character bonuses which are added to the appropriate dice roll
DND5E.ClassIdentifierHint: This class's data will be accessible using @classes.{identifier} in roll formulas.
DND5E.ClassMakeOriginalHint: First class taken by character used to determine certain class traits when multiclassing.
DND5E.ConsumeWarningNoResource: {name} is designated to consume {type} but no resource is specified!
DND5E.ConsumeWarningNoSource: The designated {type} source that {name} consumes no longer exists!
DND5E.ConsumeWarningNoQuantity: {name} has run out of its designated {type}!
DND5E.ConsumeWarningZeroAttribute: {name} has run out of its designated attribute resource pool!
DND5E.ConsumableLastChargeWarn: This is the last charge of this unit and consuming it will also reduce the item's quantity by 1
DND5E.CurrencyConvertHint: Convert all carried currency to the highest possible denomination to reduce the amount of coinage carried by the character. Be wary, this action cannot be undone.
DND5E.DamagePhysicalBypassHint: These weapon properties will bypass damage resistance for physical damage.
DND5E.DeathSaveCriticalSuccess: {name} critically succeeded on a death saving throw and has regained 1 Hit Point!
DND5E.DeathSaveSuccess: {name} has survived with 3 death save successes and is now stable!
DND5E.DeathSaveFailure: {name} has died with 3 death save failures!
DND5E.DeathSaveUnnecessary: You do not need to roll death saves because you have a positive number of hit points or have already reached 3 successes or failures.
DND5E.EffectUnavailableInfo: Source item must be equipped or attuned to activate these
DND5E.FilterNoSpells: No spells found for this set of filters.
DND5E.NoSpellLevels: This character has no spellcaster levels, but you may add spells manually.
DND5E.FlagsInstructions: Configure character features and traits which fine-tune behaviors of the DnD5e system.
DND5E.FlagsDiamondSoulHint: Gain proficiency to all saving throws.
DND5E.FlagsElvenAccuracyHint: Roll an extra d20 with advantage to Dex, Int, Wis, or Cha.
DND5E.FlagsHalflingLuckyHint: Reroll ones when rolling d20 checks.
DND5E.FlagsInitiativeAdvHint: Provided by feats or magical items.
DND5E.FlagsJOATHint: Half-Proficiency to Ability Checks in which you are not already Proficient.
DND5E.FlagsObservantHint: Provides a +5 to passive Perception and Investigation.
DND5E.FlagsRemarkableAthleteHint: Half-Proficiency (rounded-up) to physical Ability Checks and Initiative.
DND5E.FlagsWeaponCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for weapon attacks.
DND5E.FlagsSpellCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for spell attacks.
DND5E.FlagsMeleeCriticalDiceHint: A number of additional damage dice added to melee weapon critical hits.
DND5E.FormulaMissingReferenceWarn: The {property} formula within {name} has references to missing data: {references}
DND5E.HPFormulaError: The provided hit point formula could not be evaluated.
DND5E.HitDiceConfigHint: Adjust remaining hit dice levels for each class.
DND5E.HitDiceWarn: {name} has no available {formula} Hit Dice remaining!
DND5E.IdentifierError: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
DND5E.InitiativeConfigHint: Configure initiative modifiers and bonuses which apply to this Actor.
DND5E.ItemRecoveryFormulaWarning: Unable to recover charges for {name}. Invalid recovery formula '{formula}'.
DND5E.LongRestHint: Take a long rest? On a long rest you will recover hit points, half your maximum hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots.
DND5E.LongRestResult: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points and {dice} Hit Dice.
DND5E.LongRestResultHitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {dice} Hit Dice.
DND5E.LongRestResultHitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points.
DND5E.MaxCharacterLevelExceededWarn: Character cannot be advanced past level {max}.
DND5E.MaxClassLevelExceededWarn: Class cannot be advanced past level {max}.
DND5E.MaxClassLevelMinimumWarn: Class must have at least one level.
DND5E.ModuleArtConfigH: Configure which module-provided art should be used.
DND5E.Name: Character Name
DND5E.PolymorphKeepAE: Keep all effects (overrides other effect retention options).
DND5E.PolymorphKeepBackgroundAE: Keep effects that originate from your background?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepClass: Keep proficiency bonus (leaves class items in sheet)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepClassAE: Keep effects that originate from your class or subclass?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepEquipmentAE: Keep effects that originate from your equipment?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepFeatureAE: Keep effects that originate from your features?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepMental: Keep mental ability scores (Int, Wis, Cha)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from this actor (i.e. effects not attached to features, items, spells)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepOtherOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from a different actor?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepPhysical: Keep physical ability scores (Str, Dex, Con)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepSelf: Keep self (just change image and size i.e. for spells like Disguise Self)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepSpellAE: Keep effects that originate from your spells?
DND5E.PolymorphMergeSaves: Merge saving throw proficiencies (take the highest)
DND5E.PolymorphRevertNoOriginalActorWarn: No original actor was found with reference '{reference}'
DND5E.PolymorphRevertWarn: You do not have permission to revert this Actor's polymorphed state.
DND5E.PolymorphWarn: You are not allowed to polymorph this actor!
DND5E.MovementConfigHint: Configure movement speed and special movement attributes.
DND5E.NewDayHint: Recover limited use abilities which recharge "per day"?
DND5E.SaveGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all saving throws made by this actor.
DND5E.SensesConfigHint: Configure any special sensory perception abilities that this actor possesses.
DND5E.ShortRestHint: Take a short rest? On a short rest you may spend remaining Hit Dice and recover primary or secondary resources.
DND5E.ShortRestResult: {name} takes a short rest spending {dice} Hit Dice to recover {health} Hit Points.
DND5E.SkillGlobalBonusCheckHint: This bonus applies to all skill checks made by this actor.
DND5E.SpellCastNoSlots: You have no available {level} spell slots with which to cast {name}
DND5E.SubclassIdentifierHint: This identifier should match the identifier on the parent class to ensure they are properly linked.
DND5E.SubclassAssignmentError: {class} already has a subclass. Remove the existing '{subclass}' subclass before adding a new one.
DND5E.SubclassDuplicateError: A subclass with the identifier {identifier} already exists on this actor.
DND5E.SubclassMismatchWarn: {name} subclass has no matching class with identifier '{class}'.
DND5E.VehicleActionsHint: Actions taken with full crew complement
DND5E.WarnBadACFormula: The provided AC formula could not be evaluated.
DND5E.WarnCantAddMultipleAdvancements: It is not currently possible to add multiple items with advancements to an actor at the same time. Please add them individually.
DND5E.WarnMultipleArmor: More than one suit of armor equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
DND5E.WarnMultipleShields: More than one shield equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
DND5E.description: A system for playing the fifth edition of the worlds most popular roleplaying game in the Foundry Virtual Tabletop environment.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.AdditionalE: List of equipment granted by this class if taken at first level.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.AdditionalH: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the auto-generated hit points section.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.AdditionalT: List of proficiencies granted by this class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.Description: Primary description of the class that will appear first.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.FeaturesDes: As a {lowercaseName}, you gain the following class features, which are summarized in the {name} table.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.HitPointsLe: Hit Points at 1st Level: {max} + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: {dice} (or {average}) + your Constitution modifier per {class} level after 1st
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.NoValidClas: No valid class selected, press the edit button to add a class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.OptionalFea: The following section contains options {class} features. These features are not granted automatically, and you can choose one, some, or all of them at your DM's discretion.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.DND5E.Class.SubclassDes: Introduction that will be displayed before this class's subclasses.
MACRO.5eMissingTargetWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' does not have an {type} with name '{name}'.
MACRO.5eMultipleTargetsWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' has more than one {type} with name '{name}'. The first match will be chosen.
MACRO.5eNoActorSelected: No selected or assigned actor could be found to target with macro.
MACRO.5eUnownedWarn: You can only create macro buttons for owned Items
MIGRATION.5eBegin: Applying DnD5E System Migration for version {version}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.
MIGRATION.5eComplete: DnD5E System Migration to version {version} completed!
MIGRATION.5eVersionTooOldWarning: Your DnD5e system data is from too old a Foundry version and cannot be reliably migrated to the latest version. The process will be attempted, but errors may occur.
SETTINGS.5eAllowPolymorphingL: Allow players to polymorph their own actors.
SETTINGS.5eAutoCollapseCardL: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
SETTINGS.5eAutoSpellTemplateL: When a spell is cast, defaults to begin the process to create the corresponding Measured Template if any (requires TRUSTED or higher player role)
SETTINGS.5eCriticalMaxDiceL: Make critical hits more deadly by maximizing the values of base damage dice.
SETTINGS.5eCriticalModifiersL: Make critical hits more deadly by multiplying non-dice modifiers in addition to rolled dice.
SETTINGS.5eCurWtL: Carried currency affects character encumbrance following the rules on PHB pg. 143.
SETTINGS.5eDiagL: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.5eHonorL: Enable the use of the optional Honor ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.
SETTINGS.5eInitTBL: Append the raw Dexterity ability score to break ties in Initiative.
SETTINGS.5eMetricL: Replaces all reference to lbs with kgs and updates the encumbrance calculations to use metric weight units.
SETTINGS.5eNoAdvancementsL: Do not prompt for level-up or character creation choices.
SETTINGS.5eNoExpL: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
SETTINGS.5eProfL: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll. Reloading the world is required for this change to take effect.
SETTINGS.5eRestL: Configure which rest variant should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.5eSanityL: Enable the use of the optional Sanity ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.
TIDY5E.Exhaustion3: Disadvantage on Attack rolls and Saving Throws
TIDY5E.EditHint: Toggles visibility of add/delete buttons and empty sections
TIDY5E.EmptySection: This section is empty. Unlock the sheet to edit.
TIDY5E.GmOnlyEdit: Only your GM can edit this section.
TIDY5E.AttunementWarning: Attunement warning: You can't attune to more than {number} items!
TIDY5E.SearchHint: Just start to type what you are searching for.
TIDY5E.ItemCardsKeyHint: hold Key to interact with card.

TIDY5E.Settings.SheetMenu.name: Tidy Sheet Settings
TIDY5E.Settings.SheetMenu.hint: Customize your own version of Tidy
TIDY5E.Settings.SheetMenu.label: Sheet Settings
TIDY5E.Settings.SheetMenu.title: Tidy5e Sheet Settings

TIDY5E.Settings.TabLocks.hint: Prevents players from making changes to aspects of their character sheets that should change infrequently, and provides the option to completely hide some elements that you don't want to use at all. Settings are available to customize exactly what is locked / hidden, and determine who has permission to make sheets editable through a toggle button.
TIDY5E.Settings.TabLocks.hint2: Note that this is not a secure lockdown and players could get around the restrictions, so this is not a sufficient answer if your players are malicious. This is intended for games where the players are inexperienced (with D&D and/or with using computers) to prevent them from making mistakes (ex. accidentally adding/removing saving throw proficiency).

TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsForAllItems.name: Show item info cards in all layouts.
TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsForAllItems.hint: Disable if you only want the slide out item info cards in grid layout.

TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsForNpcs.name: Show item info cards for NPCs/vehicles.
TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsForNpcs.hint: Disable if you don't want the slide out item info cards for NPCs/vehicles.

TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsAreFloating.name: Item info cards float next to cursor.
TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsAreFloating.hint: Enable to detach item info cards from sheet and float them next to the cursor. Best to use with delay. Also useful when sheet is popped out.

TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsDelay.name: Delay showing info cards.
TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsDelay.hint: The Item Card will show when you hover an item for the value in milliseconds (0 = no delay, 300 is default).

TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsFixKey.name: Key to hold for Item Card interaction.
TIDY5E.Settings.ItemCardsFixKey.hint: Enter a key (e.g.: x) to use for item card interaction. Can be any key except function keys (ctrl, alt, etc.)

TIDY5E.Settings.SheetTheme.name: Tidy5e color theme.
TIDY5E.Settings.SheetTheme.hint: Use either the default light or alternate dark color theme of Tidy5e.

TIDY5E.Settings.ClassicControls.name: Use classic item controls in list view.
TIDY5E.Settings.ClassicControls.hint: Always shows item controls and disable right click menu. Only applies for PC item/spell inventory in list layout.

TIDY5E.Settings.RollButtonsToCard.name: Show midiQol Item Buttons in item's info card
TIDY5E.Settings.RollButtonsToCard.hint: Per default roll buttons appear in the item's description. Enable to move them to the item's info card. Works in all layout modes.

TIDY5E.Settings.TraitLabels.name: Show Trait Labels.
TIDY5E.Settings.TraitLabels.hint: Disable to only show icons for PC/NPC traits.

TIDY5E.Settings.PlayerName.name: Show player name.
TIDY5E.Settings.PlayerName.hint: Enable to show a field for the player name below the character's name.

TIDY5E.Settings.JournalTab.name: Hide character journal.
TIDY5E.Settings.JournalTab.hint: Enable to hide the journal tab.

TIDY5E.Settings.ClassList.name: Hide character class list.
TIDY5E.Settings.ClassList.hint: Enable to hide the class list below the character's name.

TIDY5E.Settings.InspirationAnimation.name: Inanimate inspiration tracker.
TIDY5E.Settings.InspirationAnimation.hint: Enable to turn off inspiration tracker glow animation.

TIDY5E.Settings.HideIfZero.name: Hide exhaustion and inspiration tracker on 0.
TIDY5E.Settings.HideIfZero.hint: Enable to hide exhaustion and inspiration if 0. Will show on hover.

TIDY5E.Settings.InspirationOnHover.name: Show inspiration indicator only on hover.
TIDY5E.Settings.InspirationOnHover.hint: Enable to only show the inspiration indicator when you hover over the portrait.

TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionOnHover.name: Show exhaustion tracker only on hover.
TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionOnHover.hint: Enable to only show the exhaustion tracker when you hover over the portrait.

TIDY5E.Settings.HpBar.name: Disable health bar.
TIDY5E.Settings.HpBar.hint: Enable to hide the colored bar indicating the remaining HP (Health Numbers will still be visible).

TIDY5E.Settings.HpOverlay.name: Hide hit point overlay.
TIDY5E.Settings.HpOverlay.hint: Enable to hide the HP overlay for this actor type.

TIDY5E.Settings.TraitsTogglePc.name: Toggle empty character traits.
TIDY5E.Settings.TraitsTogglePc.hint: By default empty traits are always visible. Enable to add a toggle button.

TIDY5E.Settings.TraitsMovedBelowResource.name: Move traits below resources.
TIDY5E.Settings.TraitsMovedBelowResource.hint: Enable to move traits from the left side below resources.

TIDY5E.Settings.AmmoEquippedOnly.name: Only show equipped ammunition.
TIDY5E.Settings.AmmoEquippedOnly.hint: Enable to only show currently equipped ammunition in Weapon ammo selector.

TIDY5E.Settings.TraitsAlwaysShown.name: Always show traits.
TIDY5E.Settings.TraitsAlwaysShown.hint: By default empty traits are hidden by a toggle button. Enable to never hide.

TIDY5E.Settings.SkillsAlwaysShown.name: Always show skills.
TIDY5E.Settings.SkillsAlwaysShown.hint: By default unproficient skills are hidden by a toggle button. Enable to never hide.

TIDY5E.Settings.HideSpellbookTabNpc.name: Hide Spellbook tab on NPC
TIDY5E.Settings.HideSpellbookTabNpc.hint: By default the spellbook tab on NPC is moved on the attributes tab. Disable this for never do that.

TIDY5E.Settings.ActiveEffectsMarker.name: Show Active Effects Marker on items.
TIDY5E.Settings.ActiveEffectsMarker.hint: Enable if you want to see if items have active effects on them (only for list view).

TIDY5E.Settings.RightClick.name: Disable right click context menu.
TIDY5E.Settings.RightClick.hint: In case of module conflicts or preference you can disable the right click context menu. Items will show a menu icon instead.

TIDY5E.Settings.ExpandedSheet.name: Expanded Limited view for character sheets.
TIDY5E.Settings.ExpandedSheet.hint: Displays the entire character sheet (minus the journal) to players with limited permission.

TIDY5E.Settings.PortraitStyle.name: Round portrait style.
TIDY5E.Settings.PortraitStyle.hint: Choose to enable round portraits/icons for actors.

TIDY5E.Settings.HpOverlayBorder.name: Offset hit point overlay.
TIDY5E.Settings.HpOverlayBorder.hint: Enter offset value to compensate for portrait frames and prevent tinting.

TIDY5E.Settings.EditTotalLock.name: Lock down sensitive fields.
TIDY5E.Settings.EditTotalLock.hint: Enable to prevent accidentally changing sensible, mostly static values.

TIDY5E.Settings.EditGmAlways.name: GM can always edit PC sheets.
TIDY5E.Settings.EditGmAlways.hint: Enable to allow GMs to edit PC sheets without toggling the sheet lock.

TIDY5E.Settings.EditEffectsGmOnly.name: Only GM can edit active effects.
TIDY5E.Settings.EditEffectsGmOnly.hint: Enable to deny players to edit active effects on their sheets. They will still see applied effects.

TIDY5E.Settings.QuantityAlwaysShown.name: Always show item quantity.
TIDY5E.Settings.QuantityAlwaysShown.hint: Enable to never hide item quantity.

TIDY5E.Settings.InspirationDisabled.name: Disable inspiration tracker.
TIDY5E.Settings.InspirationDisabled.hint: If your campaign doesn't use inspiration you can disable the tracker completely.

TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionEffects.name: Auto Exhaustion effects.
TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionEffects.hint: Choose how to apply exhaustion effects corresponding to tiers (requires midiQol for disadvantage rolls)
TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionEffects.tidy5e: Tidy5e - Apply integrated effects (uses Active Effects)
TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionEffects.dfredce: DFreds Convenient Effects - Use your own effects
TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionEffects.custom: Custom - Use your own effects (requires CUB)

TIDY5E.Settings.CustomExhaustionIcon.name: Custom exhaustion effect icon.
TIDY5E.Settings.CustomExhaustionIcon.hint: Set your custom exhaustion effect icon by providing an image url. Only available when Exhaustion Effect is set to "tidy 5e" (e. g.: modules/tidy5e-sheet/images/exhaustion.svg).

TIDY5E.Settings.CustomExhaustionEffect.name: Custom CUB exhaustion effect name.
TIDY5E.Settings.CustomExhaustionEffect.hint: Set the name for your custom Exhaustion Effect - must be the same as defined in CUB but WITHOUT tier number. (e. g. "Exhaustion")
TIDY5E.Settings.CustomExhaustionEffect.tiers: Number of custom CUB exhaustion tiers. Default = 5
TIDY5E.Settings.CustomExhaustionEffect.warning: Can't find actor token to apply exhaustion effect to!

TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionDisabled.name: Disable exhaustion tracker.
TIDY5E.Settings.ExhaustionDisabled.hint: If your campaign doesn't use exhaustion you can disable the tracker completely.

TIDY5E.Settings.RestingForNpcs.name: Resting for NPCs.
TIDY5E.Settings.RestingForNpcs.hint: Enable to shows the rest icon/buttons on NPC sheets.

TIDY5E.Settings.RestingForNpcsChat.name: Hide chat card for NPC rest.
TIDY5E.Settings.RestingForNpcsChat.hint: Enable to hide the Chat Card for NPC rest (applies to GM and Players).

TIDY5E.Settings.LinkMarker.name: Mark linked/unlinked NPCs.
TIDY5E.Settings.LinkMarker.hint: Adds a colored border and icon to linked/unliked NPC sheets.

TIDY5E.Settings.DefaultActionsTab.name: Default Tab when opening a sheet for the first time.

TIDY5E.Settings.HiddenDeathSaves.name: Hide Death Saves from Players.
TIDY5E.Settings.HiddenDeathSaves.hint: Enable to make Death Saves and Death Save Results only visible to the GM

TIDY5E.Settings.HideSpellSlotMarker.name: Hide Spell Slot Marker on sheet.
TIDY5E.Settings.HideSpellSlotMarker.hint: Enable to hide the colored spell slot marker, this is usually useful when the spell points variant rule is use.

TIDY5E.Settings.EnableSpellLevelButtons.name: Enable Spell Level Buttons.
TIDY5E.Settings.EnableSpellLevelButtons.hint: Enable to replaces the spell level select dropdown menu with buttons.

TIDY5E.Settings.HideStandardEncumbranceB.name: Remove/Hide standard encumbrance bar from the character sheet
TIDY5E.Settings.HideStandardEncumbranceB.hint: If enabled it will hide the standard bar of encumbrance, if you are using 'Variant Encumbrance' module you probably DO NOT NEED THIS

TIDY5E.Settings.npsSheetWidth.name: Default NPC sheet width.
TIDY5E.Settings.npsSheetWidth.hint: The width of the NPC sheet in pixels, requires a refresh to take effect (default 740).

TIDY5E.Settings.playerSheetWidth.name: Default player sheet width.
TIDY5E.Settings.playerSheetWidth.hint: The width of the player sheet in pixels, requires a refresh to take effect (default 740).

TIDY5E.Settings.vehicleSheetWidth.name: Default vehicle sheet width.
TIDY5E.Settings.vehicleSheetWidth.hint: The width of the vehicle sheet in pixels, requires a refresh to take effect (default 740).

TIDY5E.Settings.SpellClassFilterSelect.name: Enable Multiclass Spellbook filter
TIDY5E.Settings.SpellClassFilterSelect.hint: If you don't need this for your character, disabling this option will allow you to reclaim the space and declutter your sheet.

TIDY5E.Settings.SpellClassFilterIconRepl.name: Cover spell icon with class icon
TIDY5E.Settings.SpellClassFilterIconRepl.hint: Enabling this will change the spellbook tab to display the icon for the spell's class instead of the spell's image. Useful for managing multiple lists without having to switch between them.

TIDY5E.Settings.LazyHpAndExpEnable.name: Enable Lazy Hp and Exp
TIDY5E.Settings.LazyHpAndExpEnable.hint: Easily add or remove HP and Experience with automatic conversion and no overdraft. It will allow inputs like '+10', '-10', '=10', '010'

TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyEnable.name: Enable Lazy Money
TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyEnable.hint: Easily add or remove currency with automatic conversion and no overdraft. It will allow inputs like '+10', '-10', '=10', '010'

TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyAddConvert.name: Convert when adding money
TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyAddConvert.hint: Automatically convert currency to higher denominations when adding money instead of the default behaviour of preserving the denominations you receive.

TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyIgnoreElectrum.name: Ignore electrum
TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyIgnoreElectrum.hint: When converting, ignore electrum. This won't affect directly adding or removing it, except in the case when "Convert when adding money" is also enabled.

TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyChatLog.name: Chat log
TIDY5E.Settings.LazyMoneyChatLog.hint: Whisper any currency changes to the GM.

TIDY5E.Settings.AllowCantripToBePrepared.name: Allow cantrips to be 'prepared' via right-click
TIDY5E.Settings.AllowCantripToBePrepared.hint: The "cantrip formulas" optional rule from Tashas Cauldron of Everything allows Wizards to prepare their cantrips after a long rest in the same way that they do with leveled spells.

TIDY5E.Settings.LockMoneyChanges.name: Lock change money for non GM
TIDY5E.Settings.LockMoneyChanges.hint: This will lock up the money input pp, gp, ep, sp, cp on the tidy sheet for non GM player. All other module working with these fields are working just fine.

TIDY5E.Settings.LockExpChanges.name: Lock change experience for non GM
TIDY5E.Settings.LockExpChanges.hint: This will lock up the experience input on the tidy sheet for non GM player. All other module working with these fields are working just fine.

TIDY5E.Settings.LockHpMaxChanges.name: Lock change hp max for non GM
TIDY5E.Settings.LockHpMaxChanges.hint: This will lock up the hp max input on the tidy sheet for non GM player. All other module working with these fields are working just fine.

TIDY5E.Settings.LockLevelSelector.name: Lock level selector for non GM
TIDY5E.Settings.LockLevelSelector.hint: Disable Level Dropdown on the tidy sheet under Features Tab or Offer Option to Lock PLayers out from changing it. All other module working with these fields are working just fine.

TIDY5E.Settings.LockConfigureSheet.name: Lock configure sheet for non GM
TIDY5E.Settings.LockConfigureSheet.hint: Disable and hide the button for configure sheet on the tidy sheet, to avoid players to use other sheet. All other module working with these fields are working just fine.

TIDY5E.Settings.LockItemQuantity.name: Lock item quantity for non GM
TIDY5E.Settings.LockItemQuantity.hint: Enable this to lock the input quantity on the inventory and item sheet on the tidy sheet. All other module working with these fields are working just fine.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerEquipped.name: Color Picker for 'Equipped'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerEquipped.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Equipped'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerEquippedOutli.name: Color Picker for 'Equipped Outline'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerEquippedOutli.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Equipped Outline'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerEquippedAccen.name: Color Picker for 'Equipped Accent'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerEquippedAccen.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Equipped Accent'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPrepared.name: Color Picker for 'Prepared'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPrepared.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Prepared'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPreparedOutli.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Prepared Outline'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPreparedAccen.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Prepared Accent'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPact.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Pact'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPactOutline.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'PactOutline'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPactAccent.name: Color Picker for 'PactAccent'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerPactAccent.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'PactAccent'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAtWill.name: Color Picker for 'At Will'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAtWill.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'At Will'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAtWillOutline.name: Color Picker for 'At Will Outline'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAtWillOutline.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'At Will Outline'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAtWillAccent.name: Color Picker for 'At Will Accent'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAtWillAccent.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'At Will Accent'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerInnate.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Innate'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerInnateOutline.name: Color Picker for 'Innate Outline'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerInnateOutline.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Innate Outline'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerInnateAccent.name: Color Picker for 'Innate Accent'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerInnateAccent.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Innate Accent'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAlwaysPrepare.name: Color Picker for 'Always Prepared'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAlwaysPrepare.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Always Prepared'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAlwaysPrepare.name: Color Picker for 'Always Prepared Outline'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAlwaysPrepare.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Always Prepared Outline'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAlwaysPrepare.name: Color Picker for 'Always Prepared Accent'
TIDY5E.Settings.ColorPickerAlwaysPrepare.hint: Select what color you want to use for 'Always Prepared Accent'. The transparency value '#00000000' is equivalent to disabling the color for the current context.

TIDY5E.Settings.AllowHpMaxOverride.name: Allow Hp Max override on Character
TIDY5E.Settings.AllowHpMaxOverride.hint: If enable this module replace will let the GM to manually change the hp max  value on the character sheet. THIS WILL OVERRIDE THE DEFAULT BEHAVIOUR OF THE SYSTEM FOR AVOID THE RESET TO '0' ISSUE EXPLAINED HERE https://github.com/sdenec/tidy5e-sheet/issues/659

TIDY5E.Settings.Reset.name: Reset settings to default
TIDY5E.Settings.Reset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.

dialogs.title: Reset Module Settings
dialogs.content: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
